programme.title: Jerry Maguire
programme.desc: Romantic comedy starring Tom Cruise, Cuba Gooding Jr and Renée Zellweger. As a top agent at Sports Management International, Jerry Maguire knows his way around and is his own man... until one day he gets an attack of decency and finds himself out of a job. Now he must start from scratch. His only allies are a single mother, her cheeky young son and a second-rate player for the Arizona Cardinals Cameron Crowe - Director Tom Cruise - Jerry Maguire Cuba Gooding Jr - Rod Tidwell Renée Zellweger - Dorothy Boyd Kelly Preston - Avery Bishop Jerry O'Connell - Frank Cushman Jay Mohr - Bob Sugar Bonnie Hunt - Laurel Boyd Regina King - Marcee Tidwell Jonathan Lipnicki - Ray Boyd Todd Louiso - Chad the nanny Eric Stoltz - Ethan Valhere Tom Cruise - Jerry Maguire Cuba Gooding Jr - Rod Tidwell Renée Zellweger - Dorothy Boyd Kelly Preston - Avery Bishop Jerry O'Connell - Frank Cushman Jay Mohr - Bob Sugar Bonnie Hunt - Laurel Boyd Regina King - Marcee Tidwell Jonathan Lipnicki - Ray Boyd Todd Louiso - Chad the nanny Eric Stoltz - Ethan Valhere.

programme.title: The Unlikely Pilgrimage of Harold Fry
programme.desc: Devon-based pensioner Harold Fry receives a letter from his dying former work colleague, Queenie. She is living out her final few days in a Northumberland hospice. Harold spontaneously embarks on a physically gruelling 500-mile trek north. Drama, starring Jim Broadbent and Penelope Wilton Hettie Macdonald - Director Jim Broadbent - Harold Fry Penelope Wilton - Maureen Fry Earl Cave - David Fry Linda Bassett - Queenie Monika Gossmann - Martina Claire Rushbrook - Farmer's wife Jim Broadbent - Harold Fry Penelope Wilton - Maureen Fry Earl Cave - David Fry Linda Bassett - Queenie Monika Gossmann - Martina Claire Rushbrook - Farmer's wife.

programme.sub-title: Comedy, Sci Fi, Fantasy, Horror, Drama ║ 1992 ║ PG

programme.title: Meet Joe Black
programme.desc: Romantic fantasy drama starring Brad Pitt and Anthony Hopkins. Media tycoon William Parrish has lived a rich life in every sense, but fears that his days are numbered. He is offered a temporary reprieve, however, when Death takes over the body of an attractive young man and decides to spend some quality time on Earth. programme.title: Black Hawk Down
programme.sub-title: Action, Drama, History, War, Documentary And Factual ║ 2001 ║ 15
programme.desc: War drama based on real events, starring Josh Hartnett, Ewan McGregor and Tom Sizemore. On 3 October 1993, elite US troops were sent into Somalia's capital, Mogadishu, to capture two lieutenants working for the local warlord responsible for orchestrating a famine in the region. programme.sub-title: Action, Animation, Comedy, Fantasy, Children's, Family, Drama ║ 2011 ║ U
programme.desc: The tiny blue forest-dwelling creatures flee from an evil wizard, only to end up magically transported to modern-day New York. programme.title: The King's Speech
programme.desc: Oscar-winning historical drama starring Colin Firth, Helena Bonham Carter and Geoffrey Rush. As part of his royal duties, Prince Albert is required to speak at public events, a task made all the more difficult owing to his severe stammer. The death of his father and subsequent abdication of his older brother means that "Bertie" is to be crowned king. programme.title: The King's Speech
programme.desc: Oscar-winning historical drama starring Colin Firth, Helena Bonham Carter and Geoffrey Rush. As part of his royal duties, Prince Albert is required to speak at public events, a task made all the more difficult owing to his severe stammer. The death of his father and subsequent abdication of his older brother means that "Bertie" is to be crowned king. programme.title: Last Train to Christmas
programme.desc: Tony Towers, a successful nightclub manager and local celebrity, embarks upon the 3:17 to Nottingham for a Christmas family reunion in 1985, but things soon get a little strange. Moving up a carriage to the buffet car lands him in 1995, where he finds his clubs have failed and his life has fallen apart. Tony discovers that by moving up and down this fateful train, he can transport himself forward and backward to various stages of his life. Not only that, but the actions he takes in one carriage directly affect his life in the next. programme.title: Last Train to Christmas
programme.desc: Tony Towers, a successful nightclub manager and local celebrity, embarks upon the 3:17 to Nottingham for a Christmas family reunion in 1985, but things soon get a little strange. Moving up a carriage to the buffet car lands him in 1995, where he finds his clubs have failed and his life has fallen apart. Tony discovers that by moving up and down this fateful train, he can transport himself forward and backward to various stages of his life. Not only that, but the actions he takes in one carriage directly affect his life in the next. programme.title: Best PL Goals: Liverpool
programme.desc: Enjoy a selection of the very best goals scored in the Premier League by Liverpool, including memorable strikes by Steven Gerrard, Luis Suarez and many more.

programme.title: PL 100 Club: Sadio Mane
programme.desc: A celebration of Liverpool's Senegalese maestro, Sadio Mané; the third player from the continent of Africa to reach the illustrious Premier League 100 club.

programme.title: PL Greatest Games:WHU/Man Utd '16
programme.desc: Enjoy the greatest Premier League game for each of the league's 47 clubs, as voted for by fans. Here, for West Ham, their 3-2 win over Man Utd in their final game at Upton Park.

programme.title: PL Greatest Games:Wigan/Arsenal'10
programme.desc: Enjoy the greatest Premier League game for each of the league's 47 clubs, as voted for by fans. Here, for Wigan Athletic, their late comeback 3-2 win over Arsenal in April 2010.

programme.title: PL Greatest:Arsenal/Wimbledon 1997
programme.desc: Enjoy the greatest Premier League game for each of the league's 47 clubs, as voted for by fans. Here, for Wimbledon, their 1-0 victory over Arsenal back in February 1997.

programme.title: PL Greatest Games:Wolves/Leics '03
programme.desc: Enjoy the greatest Premier League game for each of the league's 47 clubs, as voted for by fans. For Wolves, their incredible 4-3 comeback win over Leicester in 2003 at Molineux.

programme.title: PL Legends: David Seaman
programme.desc: Series profiling some of the greatest players to grace the Premier League. Here the focus is on former Arsenal goalkeeper David Seaman.

programme.title: PL Legends: Paolo Di Canio

programme.title: Best PL Goals: Chelsea
programme.desc: Enjoy a selection of the very best goals scored in the Premier League by Chelsea, including memorable strikes from Didier Drogba, Frank Lampard, Eden Hazard and others.

programme.title: Best PL Goals: Newcastle
programme.desc: Enjoy all of the best goals scored over the years by Newcastle United in the Premier League, including classic strikes by Alan Shearer, Laurent Robert and others.

programme.title: PL 100 Club: Raheem Sterling
programme.desc: Raheem Sterling, the boy from Brent, has stamped his mark on the annals of Premier League history, joining the famed PL 100 Club as one of the top flight's most prolific marksmen.

programme.title: PL 100 Club: Andy Cole
programme.desc: Series profiling some of the greatest players to grace the Barclays Premier League. Here the focus is on former Newcastle United and Manchester United striker Andy Cole.

programme.title: PL Retro: Arsenal v Wigan 2006
programme.desc: Relive a classic clash as Arsenal take on Wigan Athletic on the final day of the 2005-06 campaign, as they bid farewell to one of English football's iconic grounds - Highbury.

programme.title: Gary Neville's Soccerbox
programme.desc: Gary Neville unites with his former England colleague and fellow fullback Ashley Cole, as the two Premier League greats reflect on some memorable matches they shared together.

programme.title: PL: Liverpool v United 12/13
programme.desc: United Archives 23/9/12. Always a special fixture, Sir Alex's side went to Anfield in search of their first win at the home of their fierce rivals since 2007.

programme.title: PL: United v Arsenal 05/06
programme.desc: United Archives 9/4/06. Always a big game when these teams meet. United were hoping to keep the pressure on Chelsea at the top of the league.

programme.title: PL: United v Crystal Palace 04/05
programme.desc: United Archives 18/12/04. United open their festive fixture list with the visit of Iain Dowie's Crystal Palace to Old Trafford.

programme.title: PL: Leeds v United 01/02
programme.desc: United Archives 30/3/02. Ole Gunnar Solskjaer inspired United to a vital win over Premiership rivals Leeds in a seven-goal thriller at Elland Road.

programme.title: PL: United v Man City 94/95
programme.desc: United Archives 10/11/94. A classic derby encounter as Brian Horton brought his team across the city to Old Trafford.

programme.title: PL: United v Ipswich 94/95
programme.desc: United Archives 4/3/95. An amazing goal-fest at the Theatre of Dreams in March 95 as Andy Cole scored five times in an historic 9-0 victory over Ipswich Town.

programme.title: PL: Bolton v United 95/96
programme.desc: United Archives 25/2/96. With a huge trip to Newcastle looming, United looked to keep the pressure on at the top by beating struggling Bolton.

programme.title: PL: United v Nottm Forest 95/96
programme.desc: United Archives 28/4/96. United ended their home campaign against Nottingham Forest, knowing that a win would take them to the brink of the Premiership title.

programme.title: PL: United v Sunderland 96/97
programme.desc: United Archives 21/12/96. United took on Sunderland for the first time in the Premier League on what was to be a memorable afternoon at the Theatre of Dreams.

programme.title: PL: Nottm Forest v United 98/99
programme.desc: United Archives 6/2/99. Former United boss Ron Atkinson was hoping to get one over his old club when they visited the City Ground with Forest deep in relegation trouble.

programme.title: PL: United v Bradford 00/01
programme.desc: United Archives 5/9/00. United battered the Bantams in impressive style with Teddy Sheringham and Quinton Fortune hitting a brace each.

programme.title: PL: United v Southampton 00/01
programme.desc: United Archives 28/10/00. United welcomed struggling Southampton looking to keep up their scintillating home form, having scored 22 goals in their opening six league contests at the Theatre of Dreams.

programme.title: PL: United v Arsenal 00/01
programme.desc: United Archives 25/2/01. United welcomed Arsenal knowing that victory would move them closer to securing a third consecutive Premiership crown.

programme.title: PL: United v Derby 01/02
programme.desc: United Archives 12/12/2001. After 3 Successive League defeats, United hoped to rediscover their form at home to Derby.

programme.title: PL United v Southampton 01/02

programme.desc: United legend Eric Cantona reflects on his iconic career with Andrew Mensah, as the mercurial Frenchman takes a look at some of his favourite classic kits with BT Sport.

programme.title: Eric Harrison's Class of '92
programme.desc: Special documentary looking back at the fantastic FA Youth Cup winning side of 1992, that yielded the likes of Beckham, Neville and Butt.

programme.title: All The Goals: Giggs
programme.desc: Sit back, relax and enjoy every goal that Ryan Giggs scored for United, spanning his illustrious career at the club.

programme.title: All The Goals: Cole
programme.desc: Between 1995 - 2001 Andy Cole was one of the most prolific strikers in the country, his goals helped United to glory both at home and in Europe.

programme.title: All The Goals: Ronaldo
programme.desc: Cristiano Ronaldo left an indelible mark during his first spell at Old Trafford, scoring 118 goals as he became one of the world's pre-eminent footballing talents.

programme.title: All The Goals: Van Nistelrooy
programme.desc: One of the Reds' greatest finishers, Ruud bagged 150 goals in 200 starts between 2001-2006. The stats speak for themselves, but his predatory instinct in front of goal is well worth reliving...

programme.title: All The Goals: Beckham
programme.desc: A wonderfully gifted player, David Beckham could strike a ball like no other. With pin-point precision, his free-kicks were a speciality.

programme.title: All The Goals: Cantona
programme.desc: One of the most flamboyant players ever to play the game, King Eric cemented his name in United's history between 1992-97. The Frenchman helped the Reds to four league titles and two FA Cup wins.

programme.title: All The Goals: Scholes
programme.desc: He scores goals...and lots of them in a fantastic career at United. From a fox in the box to some of the best strikes you'll ever see, this man has scored them all. A true legend.

programme.title: All The Goals: Yorke
programme.desc: A passion for goals with a smile to match. From 1998-2002 Dwight impressed with a record of more than a goal every other start.

programme.title: All The Goals: Solskjaer
programme.desc: The Norwegian forward will forever be etched in United's history with the famous winning goal in 1999. His knack of being in the right place at the right time made him a huge fans' favourite.

programme.title: All The Goals: Berbatov
programme.desc: The Bulgarian striker oozed talent and scored some memorable goals in his 4 years at United. His strike rate measured more than a goal to every other start, an impressive achievement.

programme.title: All The Goals: Sheringham
programme.desc: Teddy was 31 when he joined the Old Trafford ranks in 1997. Blessed with a gifted footballing brain he played a pivotal role in helping the Reds secure the Treble in 1999.

programme.title: All The Goals: Saha
programme.desc: Signed from Fulham in 2004, Louis Saha helped Sir Alex's side to two Premier League titles and a Champions League crown.

programme.title: All The Goals: Chicharito
programme.desc: The Little Pea joined the Reds after impressive performances for Mexico at the World Cup in 2010. His pace and clinical finishing helped United regain the Premier League trophy in 2011.

programme.title: All The Goals: Keane
programme.desc: The archetypal Captain, Roy was simply magnificent and one of the best midfielders of his generation. The Irish star grabbed many an important goal in his 13 years at Old Trafford.

programme.title: All The Goals: Rooney
programme.desc: Sit back and enjoy all 253 of our former captain Wayne Rooney's goals that made him United's greatest goalscorer - from a debut hat-trick, to that overhead kick, to the record-breaking free-kick.

programme.title: All The Goals: Fletcher
programme.desc: A dynamic presence in midfield, Darren Fletcher netted 24 goals for United, including important strikes against Chelsea and Manchester City.

programme.title: All The Goals: Ince
programme.desc: Known as 'The Guv'nor', Paul Ince spent six years at Old Trafford between 1989-95. Although not renowned for his goalscoring exploits, the England international still contributed his fair share.

programme.title: All The Goals: Forlan
programme.desc: A cult hero during his time with the Reds, the man from Uruguay scored some memorable goals, including two at Anfield that are still sung about by the United faithful.

programme.title: All The Goals: Irwin
programme.desc: An ever reliable full back and a splendid footballer with more than 520 appearances for the Reds between 1990 and 2002, Denis chipped in with his share of goals, and some great goals too.

programme.title: All The Goals: Park
programme.desc: The Korean midfielder won the adulation of the fans with his high energy, commitment and scoring of vital goals.

programme.title: All The Goals: Butt
programme.desc: One of the Class of '92, Nicky Butt rose through the ranks to make close to 400 appearances for the Reds. Weighing in with his fair share of important goals, Butty secured 9 major honours at United.

programme.title: Saves, Saves, Saves: De Gea
programme.desc: It's usually the strikers who grab all the headlines, so we put the goalkeepers in the spotlight with this collection of stunning saves.

programme.title: All The Goals: Hughes
programme.desc: Both a great goalscorer and a scorer of great goals, Mark Hughes netted plenty of spectacular goals in his two spells at Old Trafford.

programme.title: All The Goals: Van Persie
programme.desc: One of Sir Alex's finest signings, Robin van Persie helped secure a historic 20th league title for the Reds. Relive all 58 of his United goals, including his stunning strike against Aston Villa.

programme.title: All The Goals: McClair
programme.desc: Relive Brian McClair's 127 goals scored in his 11 years at the club.

programme.title: All The Goals: Kanchelskis
programme.desc: Flying Russian winger Andrei Kanchelskis enjoyed the most successful period of his career at Old Trafford, scoring crucial goals on the way to two Premier League titles.

programme.title: All The Goals: Nani
programme.desc: Nani certainly had an eye for the spectacular during his time at Old Trafford, and his goals proved key during a trophy-laden period for the club.

programme.title: All The Goals: Sharpe
programme.desc: Lee Sharpe netted 36 times in his eight years at United and soon became a fan-favourite with his entertaining goal celebrations.

programme.title: All The Goals: Welbeck
programme.desc: Local boy Danny came through the youth ranks to make his United debut in 2008. A powerful and athletic striker, he scored many an important goal before his departure in 2014.

programme.title: All The Goals: Ibrahimovic
programme.desc: Zlatan Ibrahimovic became an instant hero at Old Trafford, scoring an impressive 28 goals in 45 appearances for the Reds.

programme.title: All The Goals: Carrick
programme.desc: See all of midfield maestro Michael Carrick's 24 goals during his trophy-laden career at Old Trafford.

programme.title: All The Goals: Fellaini
programme.desc: Watch all of Belgian midfielder Marouane Fellaini's 20 goals in a Manchester United shirt.

programme.title: All The Goals: Lukaku
programme.desc: Romelu Lukaku hit the ground running in a Red shirt, watch all the Belgian's goals from his first season at Old Trafford.

programme.title: All The Goals: Rashford
programme.desc: Watch every goal of United Academy graduate Marcus Rashford as he enters the top 20 goalscorers in the club's history.

programme.title: All The Goals: Martial
programme.desc: Watch every goal by French maestro Anthony Martial since his arrival from Monaco in September 2015.

programme.title: All The Goals: Scott McTominay
programme.desc: A lifelong Red, Scott McTominay was so proud to score 29 times in 255 appearances for United.

programme.title: UTD Podcast - Altay Bayindir
programme.desc: Watch our latest UTD Podcast with GK Altay Bayindir, the first Turkish player ever to sign for Manchester United.

programme.title: UTD Podcast - Daley Blind
programme.desc: Watch our latest UTD Podcast with Daley Blind talking about a wide range of subjects, including his stint at Old Trafford and the pressure to perform.

programme.desc: Watch our latest UTD Podcast with Marc Skinner who reflects back on an incredible season for our women's team.

programme.desc: Watch our latest UTD Podcast with Ella Toone. A devoted fan growing up, her dream of playing for the Reds seemed impossible but the inception of the women's side in 2018 changed all that.

programme.title: UTD Podcast - Teddy Sheringham

programme.desc: Watch our latest UTD Podcast with academy graduate, Fraizer Campbell. He talks about the ups and downs of his career and his pivotal decision in the dramatic deadline-day Dimitar Berbatov deal.

programme.title: UTD Podcast - Ander Herrera
programme.desc: UTD Podcast co-hosts Helen Evans and Sam Homewood travelled to Bilbao, Spain, to catch up with Ander Herrera, whose honesty and passion led to one of our best-ever episodes.

programme.title: UTD Podcast - Henrik Larsson
programme.desc: Henrik told us how he couldn't resist joining United, having turned down Sir Alex once before in the 1990s.

programme.title: UTD Podcast - Owen Hargreaves
programme.desc: Owen looked back on his time working with Sir Alex Ferguson, what went through his head before taking a penalty in the 2008 Champions League Final shootout and the details of his career-ending injury.

programme.title: UTD Podcast - Mikael Silvestre
programme.desc: The former France international looked back on a glittering career at Old Trafford, and picked out some of his highligths from working with both Sir Alex Ferguson and later, Arsene Wenger at Arsenal.

programme.title: UTD Podcast - Eric Djemba-Djemba
programme.desc: The tough-tackling midfielder looked back on the moment where he and Cristiano Ronaldo came off the bench together at Old Trafford, and the words they exchanged before crossing the white line.

programme.title: PGA Tour Golf Highlights
programme.desc: Tournament highlights from the 2024 World Wide Technology Championship, held at El Cardonal at Diamante. Erik van Rooyen picked up an emotional victory at this event last year.

programme.title: PGA Tour Champions Highlights
programme.desc: The PGA Tour Champions season reaches its finale with the Charles Schwab Cup Championship at Phoenix Country Club.

programme.title: Italian F1 GP Highlights
programme.desc: It's lights out at Monza for the 2024 Italian Grand Prix. A McLaren front-row lockout sees Lando Norris lead from Oscar Piastri. Mercedes' George Russell looks to challenge from P3. (01.09).

programme.title: Fight Night Int: Davies v Lemos
programme.desc: In what is his toughest test yet, Olympic silver medallist Keyshawn Davis makes his homecoming with a lightweight bout against 28-year-old Gustavo Lemos of Buenos Aires. (09.11).

programme.title: Fight Night Int:Conceicao v Foster
programme.desc: ...v Foster. Robson Conceicao defends the WBC super featherweight title as Brazil's first Olympic boxing gold medallist meets the man he controversially dethroned, O'Shaquie Foster. (03.11).

programme.title: PGA Tour Golf Highlights
programme.desc: Tournament highlights from the 2024 World Wide Technology Championship, held at El Cardonal at Diamante. Erik van Rooyen picked up an emotional victory at this event last year.

programme.title: NFL: Eagles @ Cowboys Hlts
programme.desc: Riding a four-game winning streak, the Philadelphia Eagles find themselves in the thick of the NFC East race as Nakobe Dean and co take on division rivals Dallas. (10.11).

programme.title: WBBL: Sydney T v Perth S Hlts
programme.desc: Sydney Thunder take on Perth Scorchers in the WBBL. (12.11).

programme.title: WBBL: Hobart H v Adelaide S
programme.desc: Hobart Hurricanes match up to Adelaide Strikers in the WBBL. (13.11).

programme.title: WBBL:Adelaide S v Melbourne R Hlts
programme.desc: Adelaide Strikers clash with Melbourne Renegades in the WBBL. (11.11).

programme.title: S/Lge Grand Final:Wigan v Hul KR
programme.desc: Hull KR make their maiden Grand Final appearance as the Robins take on the current Betfred Super League champions Wigan Warriors, who make a second successive Old Trafford outing. (12.10).

programme.title: NFL: Bengals @ Ravens Hlts
programme.desc: Back to winning ways after defeat at Cleveland, Lamar Jackson and the Ravens entertain their AFC North rivals Cincinnati Bengals during week 10 of the 2024 NFL regular season. (07.11).

programme.title: DP World Tour Golf Highlights
programme.desc: The fourth and final round of the 2024 Abu Dhabi HSBC Championship, the opening event of the DP World Tour Play-Offs. (10.11).

programme.title: PGA Tour Golf Highlights
